    • Method Detail

      • addAllocatedAgent

        public void addAllocatedAgent(int auctioneerId,
                              double sw,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> itsAllocatedBundles)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        The method adds a new agents in the list of allocated auctioneers
        Parameters:
        auctioneerId - an ID of the allocated auctioneer
        sw - the social welfare
        itsAllocatedBundles - bundles allocated for this auctioneer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the allocated bundle set is empty

      • addAllocatedAgent

        public void addAllocatedAgent(int auctioneerId,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> bidders,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> itsAllocatedBundles,
                              double autioneerValue,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.Double> biddersValues)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        The method adds a new agents in the list of allocated agents (buyers in a reverse auction).
        Parameters:
        auctioneerId - an ID of an allocated agent (buyer)
        bidders - a list of bidders allocated for the given auctioneer
        itsAllocatedBundles - a list of bundles allocated for this auctioneer
        autioneerValue - an actual (not expected) value of a buyer for this allocation
        biddersValues - actual (not expected) costs of sellers allocated for the buyer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the allocated bundle set is empty

      • addAllocatedAgents

        public void addAllocatedAgents(int agentId,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> bidders,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> itsAllocatedBundles,
                               double auctioneerExpectedValue,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.Double> biddersExpectedValues,
                               boolean isReverse)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        The method adds a new agents in the list of allocated agents (buyers).
        Parameters:
        agentId - an ID of an allocated agent (buyer)
        bidders - a list of sellers' IDs allocated for this buyer
        itsAllocatedBundles - a list of bundles allocated for this agent
        auctioneerExpectedValue - an expected (not actual) value of a buyer for this allocation
        biddersExpectedValues - expected (not actual) costs of sellers allocated for the buyer
        isReverse - true if the auction is reverse and false if the auction is forward
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the allocated bundle set is empty

        public double getAllocatedWelfare()
        The method returns the total allocated welfare of allocated plans.
        Returns:
        the total welfare

      • getAllocatedBundlesByIndex

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getAllocatedBundlesByIndex(int tradeIndex)
        The method returns indices of plans allocated for the given agent
        Parameters:
        tradeIndex - an index of an agent for which the list of bundles should be returned
        Returns:
        an index of a bundle (a plan) of this agent which is allocated for the agent

      • isAllocated

        public boolean isAllocated(int agentId)
        The method checks if an agent was allocated in the CA.
        Parameters:
        agentId - - an ID of an agent to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the agent was allocated and false otherwise

      • getBiddersAllocatedValue

        public double getBiddersAllocatedValue(int tradeIdx,
                                       int bidderIdx)
        The method returns an allocated value of a buyer in a forward auction or an allocated cost of a seller in a reverse auction.
        Parameters:
        tradeIdx - - an index of an allocated trade
        bidderIdx- - an index of an allocated bidder
        Returns:
        an actually allocated value of a bidder

      • getBiddersExpectedValue

        public double getBiddersExpectedValue(int tradeIdx,
                                      int bidderIdx)
        The method returns an expected value of a buyer in a forward auction or an expected cost of a seller in a reverse auction.
        Parameters:
        tradeIdx - - an index of an allocated trade
        bidderIdx- - an index of an allocated bidder
        Returns:
        an expected value of a bidder
